discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I don't see how this is remote-access policy if it's dial-out
Isn't this supposed to be " Acceptable use policy "? As employees should be bound by set of rules and best practices when using the organisation's devices.

Ensure that a secure platform with adequate end-point and connectivity security is used. Keep the number of users to the absolute minimum number of security cleared staff, and keep this number under review.

questions.question_text: A security analyst is performing an audit on the network to determine if there are any deviations from the security policies in place. The analyst discovers that a user from the IT department had a dial-out modem installed. Which security policy must the security analyst check to see if dial-out modems are allowed?
Which of the following areas is considered a strength of symmetric key cryptography when compared with asymmetric algorithms?

discussion.content:
Asymmetric encryption usually uses complex mathematical operations, such as power and modulus, on very large numbers (2048 bits). These operations take time.

Symmetric encryption uses simpler operations, such as XOR and multiply, on smaller numbers (64 or 128 bits). Hence they run faster.

questions.question_text: Which type of security feature stops vehicles from crashing through the doors of a building?

discussion.content: bollard : a post that is put in the middle or at the end of a road to keep vehicles off or out of a particular area

questions.question_text: Which of the following viruses tries to hide from anti-virus programs by actively altering and corrupting the chosen service call interruptions when they are being run?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
CEHv12 Pg 1035: 
Stealth / Tunneling virus: These viruses try to hide from antivirus programs by actively altering and corrupting the service call interrupts while running. The virus code replaces the requests to perform operations with respect to these service call interrupts. These viruses state false information to hide their presence from antivirus programs. For example, a stealth virus hides the operations that it modified and gives false representations. Thus, it takes over portions of the target system and hides its virus code.

Stealth Virus : It is a very tricky virus as it changes the code that can be used to detect it. Hence, the detection of virus becomes very difficult. For example, it can change the read system call such that whenever user asks to read a code modified by virus, the original form of code is shown rather than infected code.

choices.C: The ACL for FTP must be before the ACL 110
choices.A: The ACL 104 needs to be first because is UDP
choices.B: The ACL 110 needs to be changed to port 80
choices.D: The first ACL is denying all TCP traffic and the other ACLs are being ignored by the router

discussion.content:
ACLs are read by the device and followed in order.
102 is the deny statement denying TCP ANY ANY 
This means everything after the 102 access list will be denied so the correct way to do this would be allow all your traffic and deny everything else after your permit statements

questions.question_text:
The security administrator of ABC needs to permit Internet traffic in the host 10.0.0.2 and UDP traffic in the host 10.0.0.3. He also needs to permit all FTP traffic to the rest of the network and deny all other traffic. After he applied his ACL configuration in the router, nobody can access to the ftp, and the permitted hosts cannot access the Internet. According to the next configuration, what is happening in the network?
